title.narrative: 4.1 EDUCATION NATIONAL SYSTEMS DEVT

description.narrative: National capacity to deliver quality primary school education is improved and there is increased availability of quality primary education services., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the GER for primary school has increased by 9 per cent, ensuring safe, equitable and quality education, with improved learning outcomes for learners at pre-primary, primary and secondary levels, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, especially girls, populations and geographic areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacity to deliver quality primary school education is improved and there is increased availability of quality primaryeducation services.

description.narrative: A total of 20,248 out-of-school children (43% girls) accessed education through Alternative Basic Education (ABE) centres in the South-Central regions. In Puntland, a total of 2,000 Grade 3 and 6 students (50% girls) participated in a Monitoring Learning Achievement assessment and the results influenced the final stages of development of the lower primary student and teacher materials. In Somaliland, 12,929 children (45% girls) benefitted from the provision of double-shifts in ABE centers. The capacity of 2,217 teachers (20% female) was enhanced through different training programmes, contributing significantly to the improved quality education services. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/12/2020
